page.title: 18Totternhoe Recreation Ground
page.content: Known locally as "The Rec", it is in the middle of the village, by the sharp bend in the road. There is a large open space in the middle. At one side there are swings and a slide for the children to play on. At the other side is the new football club pavilion. Besides week-end matches, they play on Mondays and Thursdays. The pavilion is also a club house and community centre. It has its own bar and organises fund-raising and social events. There is a Bonfire party each 5th November, which is run jointly by the football club and the school's Parents' Association. Several local groups use the pavilion as their meeting place. One such group is the "Young At Heart Club" for Senior Citizens. They meet on Wednesday afternoons and organize events for their members.
